snippet: In 2010, Shahram Amiri, a scientist, claimed on YouTube that the C.I.A. had kidnapped him. A subsequent video changed the narrative. Missing his son, he returned to Iran and disappeared....
abstract: Iranian Justice Ministry reports that scientist Shahram Amiri, who defected to United States in 2009 but returned to Iran by summer of 2010, has been hanged for spying; academic with intimate knowledge of Iran's nuclear program could not bear separation from his young son, despite being warned about dire consequences he would likely face if he returned.
lead_paragraph: In 2010, Shahram Amiri, a scientist, claimed on YouTube that the C.I.A. had kidnapped him. A subsequent video changed the narrative. Missing his son, he returned to Iran and disappeared.

headline.main: How an Iranian’s Spy Saga Ends, 6 Years Later: He’s Executed
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Spy Who Fed Secrets to the U.S. Is Executed in Iran
